channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

title.a: Knockdown - Greater Alarm Structure Fire 01/05/2024 INC#0353

item.description: Knockdown - Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#0353; 08:08AM; 8240 N Owensmouth Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3RHATSu; #CanogaPark; 48 LAFD Firefighters took just 25 minutes to confine and extinguish a carport and at least four vehicle ablaze to the rear of a 23 unit two-story garden-style apartment building that sustained only superficial damage from radiant heat and smoke thanks for firefighter's efforts. No injury. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 106; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; BC10 BC15 BC17 CM40 CM42 E104 E105 E107 E273 E296 E305 E72 EM17 RA106 RA72 RA872 SO1 T105 T73 T96; CH9; 17; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#0353; 07:43AM; 8240 N Owensmouth Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3RHATSu; #CanogaPark; PRELIM: Detached carport / garage well involved with fire, to the rear of and threatening a two-story garden-style apartment building. ; FS 106; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; BC10 BC15 BC17 CM40 CM42 E104 E105 E107 E273 E296 E72 EM17 RA106 RA72 RA872 SO1 T105 T73 T96; CH9; 17; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire - Now Out; INC#0252; 05:35AM; 501 E 7th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/48IdDuA; #Downtown; Thanks to prompt LAFD notification by the building's fire alarm monitoring service, Los Angeles Firefighters arrived quickly at a 6 story center-hallway style apartment building to find fire within one third floor unit. The first arriving 30 LAFD personnel took just 17 minutes (5:52 AM) to access, confine and fully extinguish the flames, holding the blaze within the apartment of origin. The 69 year-old male resident of the involved unit sustained severe (second-degree) burn injury to 30% of his body, and has been taken by LAFD Paramedics to a regional burn care facility in critical condition. No other injuries have been reported. The Los Angeles Fire Department reminds local residents that not all building fire alarm systems are monitored. Anyone who witnesses evidence of fire, or a ringing fire alarm, should act promptly to escape harm, and never hesitate to call 9-1-1 immediately to assure the fire department is aware and responding. The cause of this fire remains under active investigation.; FS 9; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; AR1 AR22 AR33 AR34 BC1 BC11 BC2 BC5 CM20 CM22 E14 E201 E202 E209 E210 E27 E4 E458 E9 E95 EM1 HR3 RA9 RA900 SQ21 SQ95 T1 T10 T2 T9 UR3 UR88; CH7; 12 14; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire - Now Out; INC#0225; 04:54AM; 15465 W El Cajon St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3tGYtGW; #Sylmar; 46 Firefighters took just 24 minutes (5:18 AM) to access, confine and extinguish flames in a 1,990 square foot one-story home. Though the three residents (two adults, 1 child) escaped unharmed, two pet dogs sadly perished in the flames. No other injuries reported. The American Red Cross is helping the family with immediate needs. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 91; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC10 BC12 BC15 CM40 CM42 E18 E275 E287 E298 E75 E91 E98 EM15 RA891 RA91 T75 T87 T98; CH9; 17; Brian Humphrey

title.a: Update Greater Alarm Structure Fire 01/04/2024 INC#0126

item.description: Update Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#0126; 07:25PM; 806 W Adams Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3S5BK0I; #UniversityPark; The body of a middle-aged adult male has been discovered within the vacated 150' x 200' two-story commercial building that was heavily damaged in this morning's Greater Alarm Fire. After several hours of methodically searching the premises - that include pumping a large volume of water from the building's sizeable basement, the twenty firefighters at scene have discovered no evidence of additional victims. A positive identity of the decedent, as well as the specific cause, time and manner of his death will be determined by the Medical Examiner. No other civilian or responder injuries have been reported. The cause of the fire remains under investigation.; FS 15; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; BC13 E15 E2 E210 T10; CH7; 13; Brian Humphrey

title.a: Knockdown - Greater Alarm Structure Fire 01/04/2024 INC#0126

item.description: Knockdown - Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#0126; 04:17AM; 806 W Adams Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3S5BK0I; #UniversityPark; *Address Corrected From University Avenue*. 92 LAFD Firefighters took 1 hour 53 minutes in largely defensive operations to access, confine and extinguish heavy fire in the front section of a vacant 150' x 200' two-story commercial building. No injury. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 15; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; BC1 BC11 BC13 CM20 CM22 E10 E13 E14 E15 E20 E203 E210 E215 E226 E229 E26 E3 EM11 HR3 RA15 RA3 RA803 RA815 SO1 SQ21 T10 T15 T26 T29 T3 UR3 UR88; CH9; 12 13; Brian Humphrey

Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#0126; 02:24AM; 2700 S University Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/48lbJAe; #UniversityPark; *Address Tentative* PRELIM: Defensive (exterior) firefighting operations against heavy fire showing on the second floor front section of a vacant 150' x 200' two-story commercial building.; FS 15; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; BC1 BC11 BC13 CM20 CM22 E10 E13 E14 E15 E210 E215 E226 E26 EM11 RA15 RA815 SO1 SQ21 T10 T15 T26; CH9; 12; Brian Humphrey

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1239; 03:55PM; 1303 S Tremaine Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/4azSlB7; #MidWilshire; Firefighters advanced hose lines into the burning two-story residential structure, fighting back the flames inside. It took 30 firefighters 17 minutes access, confine, and extinguish the flames. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 68; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 10; BC11 BC18 BC5 CM20 CM22 E226 E229 E26 E261 E29 E61 E68 EM11 RA29 RA61 RA829 SO1 T26 T29 T61; CH7; 12; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#1239; 03:38PM; 1303 S Tremaine Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/4azSlB7; #MidWilshire; Two-story single-family home with fire showing. Firefighters will begin with a transitional attack to cool the atmosphere with hose lines aimed upward through windows and then move directly into offensive mode.; FS 68; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 10; BC11 BC18 E229 E261 E29 E61 E68 RA29 RA829 T29 T61; CH9; 12; Nicholas Prange

title.a: KNOCKDOWN Greater Alarm Structure Fire 01/01/2024 INC#1506

item.description: KNOCKDOWN Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#1506; 12:11AM; 6415 N Van Nuys Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3RZIrBu; #VanNuys; Over 100 firefighters battled flames for 2 hours and 39 minutes in a large one-story commercial building that housed three separate businesses, and was part of a row of other commercial buildings on Van Nuys Boulevard. The primary function of the businesses in the fire building was the storage/sale of textiles (which heavily fueled the fire), but a church also operated out of the rear of the building. Crews arrived to find smoke showing, but after making entry and ventilating the roof above, flames began shooting over 30 feet out of the building. Firefighters relocated their efforts to the exterior of the building for the remainder of the fire fight, using ladder pipes and other large hose streams to fight the fire from the outside. Eventually the roof collapsed, giving firefighters a more clear shot through the top, and successfully kept the fire from spreading to the adjacent businesses, which share a wall with the fire building. Thankfully, no one was inside and there were no reported injuries. The cause of the fire remains under investigation.; FS 39; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; AR1 BC10 BC12 BC14 BC17 BC4 CM40 CM42 E100 E227 E239 E260 E27 E287 E288 E289 E293 E39 E81 E88 E89 E90 EA1 EM17 HE1 HR3 RA100 RA102 RA39 RA60 RA827 RA839 SO1 SQ87 T27 T39 T60 T87 T88 T89 T93 UR27 UR88; CH8; 17 18; Nicholas Prange
